explanations: Verb じしょform んです
い-adj じしょform んです
な-adjな じしょform んです
Nounな じしょform んです
[Note] ~んです is used in speech, in writing, ~のです is used
This expression is used when asking the listener to confirm something that the speaker has seen or heard
Or when asking the listener for more detailed information about something that the speaker has seen or heard
Or when asking the listener for a reason for something that the speaker has seen or heard
Or when asking for an explanation of a situation
examples: 1) (ぬれた 傘[かさ] 持[も]って いる 人[ひと]を 見[み]て) 雨[あめ]が 降[ふ]って いるんですか。
1) (On seeing someone holding a umbrella) Is it raining?
2) おもしろい デサインの 靴[くつ]ですね。どこで 買[か]ったんですか。
2) Those shoes have an interesting design. Where did you buy them?
3) どうして 遅[おく]れたんですか。
3) Why were you late?
4) どう したんですか。
4) What's the matter?

explanations: When giving a reason or explanation in reply to a sentence with ~んですか in it
When adding a reason to explain something one has just said
[Note] ~んです is not used when merely stating a fact
examples: 1) どうして 遅[おく]れたんですか。
1) Why were you late?
1) ... バスが 来[こ]なかったんです。
1) ... Because the bus didn't come
2) どうしたんですか。
2) Whats the matter?
2) ... ちょうと 気分[きぶん]が 悪[わる]いんです。
2) ... I don't feel very well
3) よく カラオケに いきますか。
3) Do you often go to Karaoke?
3) ... いいえ，あまり 行[い]きません。カラオケは 好[す]きじゃないんです。
3) ... No, I dont go very often. I don't like Karaoke.

explanations: ~んですが is used to introduce a topic when this is followed by a request, invitation, expression seeking permission
The が in this case is used to preface what is coming next
What follows ~んですが may be omitted when it is obvious
examples: 1) 頭[あたま]が 痛[いた]いんですが，帰[かえ]っても いいですか。
1) I've got a headache, may I go home?
2) 来週[らいしゅう] 友達[ともだち]と スキーに行[い]くんですが，ミラーさんも いしょうに いきませんか。
2) I'm going skiing with some friends next week. Would you like to come too, Mr Miller?

topic: Verb て-form いただけませんか
explanations: This expresison means 'Would you be as so kind as to ~'
This is a more polite way of asking for somthing than ~て ください。
examples: 1) いい 先生[せんせん]を 紹介[しょうかい]して いただけませんか。
1) Would you be as so kind as to introduce me to an good teacher?

topic: Interrogative Verb た-form いいですか。
explanations: This expression is used to ask the listener for advice or instructions
examples: 1) どこで カメラを 買[か]ったら いいですか。
1) Where would be a good place to buy a camera?
1) ... ABCストアが 安[やす]いですよ。
1) ... ABC store is cheap, you know
2) 国会議事堂[こっかいぎじどう]を 見学[けんがく]したいですが，どこ したら いいですか。
2) I'll like to visit the National Diet, how should I go about it?
2) ... 直接[ちょくせつ] 行[い]ったら いいですよ。
2) ... You can head there directly, you know.

topic: Object Noun は 好[す]きです/きらいです
explanations: Nouns indicated by が that are the object of phrases such as 好[す]きです can also be made into a topic
examples: 1) よく カラオケに 行[いき]ますか。
1) Do you often go to Karaoke?
1) ... いいえ，あまり 行[い]きません。カラオケは 好[す]きじゃないんです。
3) ... No, I dont go very often. I don't like Karaoke.
